desc: When you attack an enemy in melee, roll+Str.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you deal your damage to the enemy and avoid their attack. At your option, you may choose to do +1d6 damage but expose yourself to the enemy's attack.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, you deal your damage to the enemy and the enemy makes an attack against you.
0.name: Hack and Slash

desc: When you take aim and shoot at an enemy at range, roll+Dex.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you have a clear shot - deal your damage.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, choose one (whichever you choose you deal your damage):
• You have to move to get the shot placing you in danger as described by the GM
• You have to take what you can get: -1d6 damage
• You have to take several shots, reducing your ammo by one
1.name: Volley

desc: When you act despite an imminent threat or suffer a calamity, say how you deal with it and roll. If you do it ...
•  ...by powering through, +Str
•  ...by getting out of the way or acting fast, +Dex
•  ...by enduring, +Con
•  ...with quick thinking, +Int
•  ...through mental fortitude, +Wis
•  ...using charm and social grace, +Cha
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you do what you set out to, the threat doesn't come to bear.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, you stumble, hesitate, or flinch: the GM will offer you a worse outcome, hard bargain, or ugly choice.
2.name: Defy Danger

desc: When you stand in defense of a person, item, or location under attack, roll+Con.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, hold 3.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, hold 1. As long as you stand in defense, when you or the thing you defend is attacked you may spend hold, 1 for 1, to choose an option:
• Redirect an attack from the thing you defend to yourself
• Halve the attack's effect or damage
• Open up the attacker to an ally giving that ally +1 forward against the attacker
• Deal damage to the attacker equal to your level
3.name: Defend

desc: When you consult your accumulated knowledge about something, roll+Int.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, the GM will tell you something interesting and useful about the subject relevant to your situation.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, the GM will only tell you something interesting - it's on you to make it useful. The GM might ask you "How do you know this?" Tell them the truth, now.
4.name: Spout Lore

desc: When you closely study a situation or person, roll+Wis.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, ask the GM 3 questions from the list below.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, ask 1.
Either way, take +1 forward when acting on the answers.
• What happened here recently?
• What is about to happen?
• What should I be on the lookout for?
• What here is useful or valuable to me?
• Who's really in control here?
• What here is not what it appears to be?
5.name: Discern Realities

desc: When you have leverage on a GM Character and manipulate them, roll+Cha. Leverage is something they need or want.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, they do what you ask if you first promise what they ask of you.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, they will do what you ask, but need some concrete assurance of your promise, right now.
6.name: Parley

desc: When you help or hinder someone , roll+bond with them.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, they take +1 or -2 to their roll, your choice.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, they still get a modifier, but you also expose yourself to danger, retribution, or cost.
7.name: Aid or Interfere

desc: When you're dying you catch a glimpse of what lies beyond the Black Gates of Death's Kingdom (the GM will describe it). Then roll (just roll, +nothing - yeah, Death doesn't care how tough or cool you are).
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you've cheated Death - you're in a bad spot but you're still alive.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, Death himself will offer you a bargain. Take it and stabilize or refuse and pass beyond the Black Gates into whatever fate awaits you.
:small_orange_diamond:On 6-, your fate is sealed. You're marked as Death's own and you'll cross the threshold soon. The GM will tell you when.
8.name: ###Last Breath

desc: When you make a move while carrying weight you may be encumbered. If your weight carried is:
• Equal to or less than your Load, you suffer no penalty
• Less than or equal to your Load+2, you take -1 ongoing until you lighten your burden
• Greater than your Load+2, you have a choice: drop at least 1 weight and roll at -1, or automatically fail
9.name: Encumbrance

desc: When you're on watch and something approaches the camp roll+Wis.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you're able to wake the camp and prepare a response, everyone in the camp takes +1 forward.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, you react just a moment too late; your companions in camp are awake but haven't had time to prepare. They have weapons and armor but little else.
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, whatever lurks outside the campfire's light has the drop on you.
10.name: Take Watch

desc: When you travel through hostile territory, choose one member of the party to act as trailblazer, one to scout ahead, and one to be quartermaster. Each character with a job to do rolls+Wis.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+:
• the quartermaster reduces the number of rations required by one
• the trailblazer reduces the amount of time it takes to reach your destination (the GM will say by how much)
• the scout will spot any trouble quick enough to let you get the drop on it

:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, each role performs their job as expected: the normal number of rations are consumed, the journey takes about as long as expected, no one gets the drop on you but you don't get the drop on them either.
11.name: ###Undertake a Perilous Journey

desc: When you reach the end of a session, choose one of your bonds that you feel is resolved (completely explored, no longer relevant, or otherwise). Ask the player of the character you have the bond with if they agree. If they do, mark XP and write a new bond with whomever you wish.
Once bonds have been updated look at your alignment. If you fulfilled that alignment at least once this session, mark XP. Then answer these three questions as a group:
• Did we learn something new and important about the world?
• Did we overcome a notable monster or enemy?
• Did we loot a memorable treasure?
For each "yes" answer everyone marks XP.
12.name: End of Session

desc: When you have downtime (hours or days) and XP equal to (or greater than) your current level+7, you can reflect on your experiences and hone your skills.
• Subtract your current level+7 from your XP.
• Increase your level by 1.
• Choose a new advanced move from your class.
• If you are the wizard, you also get to add a new spell to your spellbook.
• Choose one of your stats and increase it by 1 (this may change your modifier). Changing your Constitution increases your maximum and current HP. Ability scores can't go higher than 18.
13.name: Level Up

desc: When you return triumphant and throw a big party, spend 100 coins and roll +1 for every extra 100 coins spent.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, choose 3.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, choose 1.
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, you still choose one, but things get really out of hand (the GM will say how).
• You befriend a useful NPC.
• You hear rumors of an opportunity.
• You gain useful information.
• You are not entangled, ensorcelled, or tricked.
14.name: Carouse

desc: When you go to buy something with gold on hand, if it's something readily available in the settlement you're in, you can buy it at market price. If it's something special, beyond what's usually available here, or non-mundane, roll+Cha.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you find what you're looking for at a fair price.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, you'll have to pay more or settle for something that's not exactly what you wanted, but close. The GM will tell you what your options are.
15.name: Supply

desc: When you do nothing but rest in comfort and safety after a day of rest you recover all your HP. After three days of rest you remove one debility of your choice. If you're under the care of a healer (magical or otherwise) you heal a debility for every two days of rest instead.
16.name: Recover

desc: When you put out word that you're looking to hire help, roll:
• +1 if you make it known that your pay is generous
• +1 if you make it known what you're setting out to do
• +1 if you make it known that they'll get a share of whatever you find
• +1 if you have a useful reputation around these parts
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you've got your pick of a number of skilled applicants, your choice who you hire, no penalty for not taking them along.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, you'll have to settle for someone close to what you want or turn them away.

:small_orange_diamond:On a miss someone influential and ill-suited declares they'd like to come along (a foolhardy youth, a loose-cannon, or a veiled enemy, for example), bring them and take the consequences or turn them away. If you turn away applicants you take -1 forward to recruit.
17.name: Recruit

desc: When you return to a civilized place in which you've caused trouble before, roll+Cha.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, word has spread of your deeds and everyone recognizes you.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, as above, and the GM chooses a complication:
• The local constabulary has a warrant out for your arrest.
• Someone has put a price on your head.
• Someone important to you has been put in a bad spot as a result of your actions.
18.name: Outstanding Warrants

desc: When you spend your leisure time in study, meditation, or hard practice, you gain preparation. If you prepare for a week or more, take 1 preparation. If you prepare for a month or longer, take 3 instead. When your preparation pays off spend 1 preparation for +1 to any roll. You can only spend one preparation per roll.
19.name: Bolster

desc: When you weave a performance into a basic spell, choose an ally and an effect:
• Heal 1d8 damage
• +1d4 forward to damage
• Their mind is shaken clear of one enchantment
• The next time someone successfully assists the target with aid, they get +2 instead of +1
Then roll+Cha.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, the ally gets the selected effect.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, your spell still works, but you draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM's choice.
20.name: Arcane Art

desc: Choose an area of expertise:
• Spells and Magicks
• The Dead and Undead
• Grand Histories of the Known World
• A Bestiary of Creatures Unusual
• The Planar Spheres
• Legends of Heroes Past
• Gods and Their Servants

When you first encounter an important creature, location, or item (your call) covered by your bardic lore you can ask the GM any one question about it; the GM will answer truthfully. The GM may then ask you what tale, song, or legend you heard that information in.
21.name: Bardic Lore

desc: When you speak frankly with someone, you can ask their player a question from the list below. They must answer it truthfully, then they may ask you a question from the list (which you must answer truthfully).
• Whom do you serve?
• What do you wish I would do?
• How can I get you to ______?
• What are you really feeling right now?
• What do you most desire?
22.name: Charming and Open

desc: When you return to a civilized settlement you've visited before, tell the GM when you were last here. They'll tell you how it's changed since then.
23.name: A Port in the Storm

desc: When you heal with arcane art, you heal +1d8 damage.
24.name: Healing Song

desc: When you grant bonus damage with arcane art, you grant an extra +1d4 damage.
25.name: Vicious Cacophony

desc: When you unleash a crazed performance (a righteous lute solo or mighty brass blast, maybe) choose a target who can hear you and roll+Cha.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ the target attacks their nearest ally in range.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 they attack their nearest ally, but you also draw their attention and ire.
26.name: It Goes To Eleven

desc: When you shout with great force or play a shattering note choose a target and roll+Con.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ the target takes 1d10 damage and is deafened for a few minutes.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 you still damage your target, but it's out of control: the GM will choose an additional target nearby.
27.name: Metal Hurlant

desc: When you successfully aid someone you take +1 forward as well.
28.name: A Little Help From My Friends

desc: Your arcane art is strong, allowing you to choose two effects instead of one.
29.name: Eldritch Tones

desc: When you hack and slash, you take +1 armor forward.
30.name: Duelist's Parry

desc: When you parley with someone, on a 7+ you also take +1 forward with them.
31.name: Bamboozle

desc: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
32.name: Multiclass Dabbler

desc: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
33.name: Multiclass Initiate

desc: *Replaces: Healing Song*
When you heal with arcane art, you heal +2d8 damage.
34.name: Healing Chorus

desc: *Replaces: Vicious Cacophony*
When you grant bonus damage with arcane art, you grant an extra +2d4 damage.
35.name: Vicious Blast

desc: When you meet someone you've met before (your call) after some time apart you take +1 forward against them.
36.name: Unforgettable Face

desc: When you first meet someone who's heard songs about you, roll+Cha.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, tell the GM two things they've heard about you.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, tell the GM one thing they've heard, and the GM tells you one thing.
37.name: Reputation

desc: *Replaces: Eldritch Tones*
When you use arcane art, you choose two effects. You also get to choose one of those effects to double.
38.name: Eldritch Chord

desc: When you hear an enemy cast a spell the GM will tell you the name of the spell and its effects. Take +1 forward when acting on the answers.
39.name: An Ear For Magic

desc: When you use charming and open you may also ask "How are you vulnerable to me?" Your subject may not ask this question of you.
40.name: Devious

desc: *Replaces: Duelist's Parry*
When you hack and slash, you take +2 armor forward.
41.name: Duelist's Block

desc: *Replaces: Bamboozle*
When you parley with someone, on a 7+ you also take +1 forward with them and get to ask their player one question which they must answer truthfully.
42.name: Con

desc: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
43.name: Multiclass Master

desc: You serve and worship some deity or power which grants you spells. Give your god a name (maybe Helferth, Sucellus, Zorica or Krugon the Bleak) and choose your deity's domain:
• Healing and Restoration
• Bloody Conquest
• Civilization
• Knowledge and Hidden Things
• The Downtrodden and Forgotten
• What Lies Beneath
Choose one precept of your religion:
• Your religion preaches the sanctity of suffering, add Petition: Suffering
• Your religion is cultish and insular, add Petition: Gaining Secrets
• Your religion has important sacrificial rites, add Petition: Offering
• Your religion believes in trial by combat, add Petition: Personal Victory
44.name: Deity

desc: When you petition your deity according to the precept of your religion, you are granted some useful knowledge or boon related to your deity's domain. The GM will tell you what.
45.name: Divine Guidance

desc: When you hold your holy symbol aloft and call on your deity for protection, roll+Wis.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7+, so long as you continue to pray and brandish your holy symbol, no undead may come within reach of you.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you also momentarily daze intelligent undead and cause mindless undead to flee.
Aggression breaks the effects and they are able to act as normal. Intelligent undead may still find ways to harry you from afar. They're clever like that.
46.name: Turn Undead

desc: When you spend uninterrupted time (an hour or so) in quiet communion with your deity, you:
• Lose any spells already granted to you.
• Are granted new spells of your choice whose total levels don't exceed your own level+1, and none of which is a higher level than your own level.
• Prepare all of your rotes, which never count against your limit.
47.name: Commune

desc: When you unleash a spell granted to you by your deity, roll+Wis.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, the spell is successfully cast and your deity does not revoke the spell, so you may cast it again.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, the spell is cast, but choose one:
• You draw unwelcome attention or put yourself in a spot. The GM will tell you how.
• Your casting distances you from your deity - take -1 ongoing to cast a spell until the next time you commune.
• After you cast it, the spell is revoked by your deity. You cannot cast the spell again until you commune and have it granted to you.
Note that maintaining spells with ongoing effects will sometimes cause a penalty to your roll to cast a spell.
48.name: Cast a Spell

desc: Choose one spell. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower.
49.name: Chosen One

desc: When you heal someone they take +2 forward to their damage.
50.name: Invigorate

desc: When someone takes their last breath in your presence, they take +1 to the roll.
51.name: The Scales of Life and Death

desc: When you cast a spell you ignore the first -1 penalty from ongoing spells.
52.name: Serenity

desc: Cure Light Wounds is a rote for you, and therefore doesn't count against your limit of granted spells.
53.name: First Aid

desc: When you commune you get 1 hold and lose any hold you already had. Spend that hold when you or an ally takes damage to call on your deity, they intervene with an appropriate manifestation (a sudden gust of wind, a lucky slip, a burst of light) and negate the damage.
54.name: Divine Intervention

desc: When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +1d4 damage (ignoring armor). If you do, take +1 forward to cast a spell.
55.name: Penitent

desc: When you cast a spell, on a 10+ you have the option of choosing from the 7-9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well:
• The spell's effects are doubled
• The spell's targets are doubled
56.name: Empower

desc: When you sacrifice something of value to your deity and pray for guidance, your deity tells you what it would have you do. If you do it, mark experience.
57.name: Orison for Guidance

desc: When you wear no armor or shield you get 2 armor.
58.name: Divine Protection

desc: When you heal someone else of damage, add your level to the amount of damage healed.
59.name: Devoted Healer

desc: *Requires: Chosen One*
Choose one spell in addition to the one you picked for chosen one. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower.
60.name: Anointed

desc: The first time you spend time in prayer as appropriate to your god after taking this move, choose a feature associated with your deity (rending claws, wings of sapphire feathers, an all-seeing third eye, etc.). When you emerge from prayer, you permanently gain that physical feature.
61.name: Apotheosis

desc: When you take time after a conflict to dedicate your victory to your deity and deal with the dead, take +1 forward.
62.name: Reaper

desc: *Replaces: Serenity*
You ignore the -1 penalty from two spells you maintain.
63.name: Providence

desc: *Requires: First Aid*
Cure Moderate Wounds is a rote for you, and therefore doesn't count against your limit of granted spells.
64.name: Greater First Aid

desc: *Replaces: Divine Intervention*

When you commune you gain 2 hold and lose any hold you already had. Spend that hold when you or an ally takes damage to call on your deity, who intervenes with an appropriate manifestation (a sudden gust of wind, a lucky slip, a burst of light) and negates the damage.
65.name: Divine Invincibility

desc: *Replaces: Penitent*
When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +1d4 damage (ignoring armor). If you do, take +1 forward to cast a spell and add your level to any damage done or healed by the spell.
66.name: Martyr

desc: *Replaces: Divine Protection*
When you wear no armor or shield you get 3 armor.
67.name: Divine Armor

desc: *Replaces: Empower*
When you cast a spell, on a 10-11 you have the option of choosing from the 7-9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well. On a 12+ you get to choose one of these effects for free.
• The spell's effects are doubled
• The spell's targets are doubled
68.name: Greater Empower

desc: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
69.name: Multiclass Dabbler

desc: You learned your magic in a place whose spirits are strong and ancient and they've marked you as one of their own. No matter where you go, they live within you and allow you to take their shape. Choose one of the following. It is the land to which you are attuned - when shapeshifting you may take the shape of any animal who might live in your Land.
• The Great Forests
• The Whispering Plains
• The Vast Desert
• The Stinking Mire
• The River Delta
• The Depths of the Earth
• The Sapphire Islands
• The Open Sea
• The Towering Mountains
• The Frozen North
• The Blasted Wasteland

Chose a tell - a physical attribute that marks you as born of the soil - that reflects the spirit of your land. It may be an animal feature like antlers or leopard's spots or something more general: hair like leaves or eyes of glittering crystal. Your tell remains no matter what shape you take.
70.name: Born of the Soil

desc: You don't need to eat or drink. If a move tells you to mark off a ration just ignore it.
71.name: By Nature Sustained

desc: The grunts, barks, chirps, and calls of the creatures of the wild are as language to you. You can understand any animal native to your land or akin to one whose essence you have studied.
72.name: Spirit Tongue

desc: When you call upon the spirits to change your shape, roll+Wis.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ hold 3.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 hold 2. :small_orange_diamond:On a miss hold 1 in addition to whatever the GM says.

You may take on the physical form of any species whose essence you have studied or who lives in your land: you and your possessions meld into a perfect copy of the species' form. You have any innate abilities and weaknesses of the form: claws, wings, gills, breathing water instead of air. You still use your normal stats but some moves may be harder to trigger - a housecat will find it hard to do battle with an ogre. The GM will also tell you one or more moves associated with your new form. Spend 1 hold to make that move. Once you're out of hold, you return to your natural form. At any time, you may spend all your hold and revert to your natural form.
73.name: Shapeshifter

desc: When you spend time in contemplation of an animal spirit, you may add its species to those you can assume using shapeshifting.
74.name: Studied Essence

desc: Choose one move from the ranger class list.
75.name: Hunter's Brother

desc: When you are in an appropriate animal form (something dangerous) increase your damage to d8.
76.name: Red of Tooth and Claw

desc: When you spend time in a place, making note of its resident spirits and calling on the spirits of the land, roll+Wis. You will be granted a vision of significance to you, your allies, and the spirits around you.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ the vision will be clear and helpful to you.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 the vision is unclear, its meaning murky.
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, the vision is upsetting, frightening, or traumatizing. The GM will describe it. Take -1 forward.
77.name: Communion of Whispers

desc: So long as your feet touch the ground you have +1 armor.
78.name: Barkskin

desc: When you mark an animal (with mud, dirt, or blood) you can see through that animal's eyes as if they were your own, no matter what distance separates you. Only one animal at a time may be marked in this way.
79.name: Eyes of the Tiger

desc: When you take damage while shapeshifted you may choose to revert to your natural form to negate the damage.
80.name: Shed

desc: You see the spirits in the sand, the sea and the stone. You may now apply your spirit tongue, shapeshifting and studied essence to inanimate natural objects (plants and rocks) or creatures made thereof, as well as animals. Thing-talker forms can be exact copies or can be mobile vaguely humanoid-shaped entities.
81.name: Thing-Talker

desc: When you shapeshift choose a stat: you take +1 ongoing to rolls using that stat while shifted. The GM will choose a stat, too: you take -1 ongoing to rolls using that stat while shifted.
82.name: Formcrafter

desc: When you call on the primal spirits of fire, water, earth or air to perform a task for you roll+Wis.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ choose two.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 choose one.
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, some catastrophe occurs as a result of your calling.
• The effect you desire comes to pass
• You avoid paying nature's price
• You retain control
83.name: Elemental Mastery

desc: When you deal damage, take 1 balance. When you touch someone and channel the spirits of life you may spend balance. For each balance spent, heal 1d4 HP.
84.name: Balance

desc: When you shapeshift, roll 1d4 and add that total to your hold.
85.name: Embracing No Form

desc: You are able to study the essence of specific individuals to take their exact form, including men, elves, or the like. Suppressing your tell is possible, but if you do, take -1 ongoing until you return to your own form.
86.name: Doppelganger's Dance

desc: *Replaces: Red of Tooth and Claw*
When you are in an appropriate animal form (something dangerous) increase your damage to d10.
87.name: Blood and Thunder

desc: When you take this move, the next opportunity that you have safety and time to spend in an appropriate location, you may attune yourself to a new land. This effect occurs only once and the GM will tell you how long it will take and what cost you must pay. From then on, you are considered to be born of the soil in both lands.
88.name: The Druid Sleep

desc: *Requires: Thing-Talker*
You see the patterns that make up the fabric of the world. You may now apply your spirit tongue, shapeshifter and studied essence moves to pure elements - fire, water, air and earth.
89.name: World-Talker

desc: Choose one move from the ranger class list.
90.name: Stalker's Sister

desc: *Requires: Formcrafter*
You may increase your armor by 1 or deal an additional +1d4 damage while in an animal form. Choose which when you shapeshift.
91.name: Formshaper

desc: When you shapeshift, you may create a merged form of up to three different shapes. You may be a bear with the wings of an eagle and the head of a ram, for example. Each feature will grant you a different move to make. Your chimera form follows the same rules as shapeshifter otherwise.
92.name: Chimera

desc: When you are under open skies when the sun rises the GM will ask you what the weather will be that day. Tell them whatever you like, it comes to pass.
93.name: Weather Weaver

desc: When you use pure strength to destroy an inanimate obstacle, roll+Str.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, choose 3.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 choose 2.
• It doesn't take a very long time
• Nothing of value is damaged
• It doesn't make an inordinate amount of noise
• You can fix the thing again without a lot of effort
94.name: Bend Bars, Lift Gates

desc: You ignore the clumsy tag on armor you wear.
95.name: Armored

desc: This is your weapon. There are many like it, but this one is yours. Your weapon is your best friend. It is your life. You master it as you master your life. Your weapon, without you, is useless. Without your weapon, you are useless. You must wield your weapon true.
Choose a base description, all are 2 weight:
• Sword
• Axe
• Hammer
• Spear
• Flail
• Fists
Choose the range that best fits your weapon:
• Hand
• Close
• Reach
Choose two enhancements:
• Hooks and spikes. +1 damage, but +1 weight.
• Sharp. +2 piercing.
• Perfectly weighted. Add precise.
• Serrated edges. +1 damage.
• Glows in the presence of one type of creature, your choice.
• Huge. Add messy and forceful.
• Versatile. Choose an additional range.
• Well-crafted. -1 weight.
Choose a look:
• Ancient
• Unblemished
• Ornate
• Blood-stained
• Sinister
96.name: Signature Weapon

desc: When you deal damage, deal +1d4 damage.
97.name: Merciless

desc: When you consult the spirits that reside within your signature weapon, they will give you an insight relating to the current situation, and might ask you some questions in return, roll+CHA.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, the GM will give you good detail.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, the GM will give you an impression.
98.name: Heirloom

desc: When you make your armor take the brunt of damage dealt to you, the damage is negated but you must reduce the armor value of your armor or shield (your choice) by 1. The value is reduced each time you make this choice. If the reduction leaves the item with 0 armor it is destroyed.
99.name: Armor Mastery

desc: Choose one extra enhancement for your signature weapon.
100.name: Improved Weapon

desc: When you discern realities during combat, you take +1.
101.name: Seeing Red

desc: When you parley using threats of impending violence as leverage, you may use STR instead of CHA.
102.name: Interrogator

desc: When you hack and slash an enemy, your next attack against that same foe deals +1d4 damage.
103.name: Scent of Blood

desc: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
104.name: Multiclass Dabbler

desc: You gain +1 armor.
105.name: Iron Hide

desc: When you have access to a forge you can graft the magical powers of a weapon onto your signature weapon. This process destroys the magical weapon. Your signature weapon gains the magical powers of the destroyed weapon.
106.name: Blacksmith

desc: *Replaces: Merciless*
When you deal damage, deal +1d8 damage.
107.name: Bloodthirsty

desc: *Replaces: Armor Mastery*

When you choose to let your armor take the brunt of damage dealt to you, the damage is negated and you take +1 forward against the attacker, but you must reduce the armor value of your armor or shield (your choice) by 1. The value is reduced each time you make this choice. If the reduction leaves the item with 0 armor it is destroyed.
108.name: Armored Perfection

desc: *Requires: Seeing Red*
When you enter combat, roll+CHA.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, hold 2.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, hold 1.
Spend your hold to make eye contact with an NPC present, who freezes or flinches and can't act until you break it off.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 6-, your enemies immediately identify you as their biggest threat.
109.name: Evil Eye

desc: *Replaces: Scent of Blood*
When you hack and slash an enemy, your next attack against that same foe deals +1d8 damage.
110.name: Taste of Blood

desc: *Requires: Multiclass Dabbler*
Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
111.name: Multiclass Initiate

desc: *Replaces: Iron Hide*
You gain +2 armor.
112.name: Steel Hide

desc: When you go into battle, roll+WIS.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, name someone who will live and someone who will die.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, name someone who will live or someone who will die.
Name NPCs, not player characters. The GM will make your vision come true, if it's even remotely possible.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 6- you see your own death and consequently take -1 ongoing throughout the battle.
113.name: Through Death's Eyes

desc: When you look over an enemy's weaponry, ask the GM how much damage they do.
114.name: Eye for Weaponry

desc: When you hack and slash on a 12+ you deal your damage, avoid their attack, and impress, dismay, or frighten your enemy.
115.name: Superior Warrior

desc: When you touch someone, skin to skin, and pray for their well-being , roll+CHA.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ you heal 1d8 damage or remove one disease.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, they are healed, but the damage or disease is transferred to you.
116.name: Lay on Hands

desc: You ignore the clumsy tag on armor you wear.
117.name: Armored

desc: When you give an NPC an order based on your divine authority, roll+Cha.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7+, they choose one:
• Do what you say
• Back away cautiously, then flee
• Attack you
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you also take +1 forward against them.
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, they do as they please and you take -1 forward against them.
118.name: I Am the Law

desc: When you dedicate yourself to a mission through prayer and ritual cleansing, state what you set out to do:
• Slay _______, a great blight on the land
• Defend _______ from the iniquities that beset them
• Discover the truth of _______
Then choose up to two boons:
• An unwavering sense of direction to _______.
• Invulnerability to _______ (e.g., edged weapons, fire, enchantment, etc.)
• A mark of divine authority
• Senses that pierce lies
• A voice that transcends language
• A freedom from hunger, thirst, and sleep
The GM will then tell you what vow or vows is required of you to maintain your blessing:
• Honor (forbidden: cowardly tactics and tricks)
• Temperance (forbidden: gluttony in food, drink, and pleasure of the flesh)
• Piety (required: observance of daily holy services)
• Valor (forbidden: suffering an evil creature to live)
• Truth (forbidden: lies)
• Hospitality (required: comfort to those in need, no matter who they are)
119.name: Quest

desc: Dedicate yourself to a deity (name a new one or choose one that's already been established). You gain the commune and cast a spell cleric moves. When you select this move, treat yourself as a cleric of level 1 for using spells. Every time you gain a level thereafter, increase your effective cleric level by 1.
120.name: Divine Favor

desc: When you take damage you can grit your teeth and accept the blow. If you do you take no damage but instead suffer a debility of your choice. If you already have all six debilities you can't use this move.
121.name: Bloody Aegis

desc: While on a quest you deal +1d4 damage.
122.name: Smite

desc: When you speak aloud your promise to defeat an enemy, you deal +2d4 damage against that enemy and -4 damage against anyone else. This effect lasts until the enemy is defeated. If you fail to defeat the enemy or give up the fight, you can admit your failure, but the effect continues until you find a way to redeem yourself.
123.name: Exterminatus

desc: When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead take +1 forward.
124.name: Charge!

desc: When you defend you always get +1 hold, even on a 6-.
125.name: Staunch Defender

desc: When you hack and slash, choose an ally. Their next attack against your target does +1d4 damage.
126.name: Setup Strike

desc: You get +1 armor while on a quest.
127.name: Holy Protection

desc: Take +1 to order hirelings.
128.name: Voice of Authority

desc: When you heal an ally, you heal +1d8 damage.
129.name: Hospitaller

desc: *Requires: Divine Favor*
When you see divine magic as it happens, you can ask the GM which deity granted the spell and its effects. Take +1 when acting on the answers.
130.name: Evidence of Faith

desc: *Replaces: Smite*
While on a quest you deal +1d8 damage.
131.name: Holy Smite

desc: *Replaces: Charge!*
When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead take +1 forward and +2 armor forward.
132.name: Ever Onward

desc: *Replaces: Staunch Defender*

When you defend you always get +1 hold, even on a 6-. When you get a 12+ to defend instead of getting hold the nearest attacking creature is stymied giving you a clear advantage, the GM will describe it.
133.name: Impervious Defender

desc: *Replaces: Setup Strike*
When you hack and slash, choose an ally. Their next attack against your target does +1d4 damage and they take +1 forward against them.
134.name: Tandem Strike

desc: *Replaces: Holy Protection*
You get +2 armor while on a quest.
135.name: Divine Protection

desc: *Replaces: Voice of Authority*
Take +1 to order hirelings. When you roll a 12+ the hireling transcends their moment of fear and doubt and carries out your order with particular effectiveness or efficiency.
136.name: Divine Authority

desc: *Replaces: Hospitaller*
When you heal an ally, you heal +2d8 damage.
137.name: Perfect Hospitaller

desc: When you suffer a debility (even through Bloody Aegis) take +1 forward against whatever caused it.
138.name: Indomitable

desc: When you quest you choose three boons instead of two.
139.name: Perfect Knight

desc: When you follow a trail of clues left behind by passing creatures, roll+WIS.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7+, you follow the creature's trail until there's a significant change in its direction or mode of travel.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you also choose 1:
• Gain a useful bit of information about your quarry, the GM will tell you what
• Determine what caused the trail to end
140.name: Hunt and Track

desc: When you attack a defenseless or surprised enemy at range, you can choose to deal your damage or name your target and roll+DEX.
• Head :small_orange_diamond:10+: As 7-9, plus your damage :small_orange_diamond:7-9: They do nothing but stand and drool for a few moments.
• Arms :small_orange_diamond:10+: As 7-9, plus your damage :small_orange_diamond:7-9: They drop anything they're holding.
• Legs :small_orange_diamond:10+: As 7-9, plus your damage :small_orange_diamond:7-9: They're hobbled and slow moving.
141.name: Called Shot

desc: You have a supernatural connection with a loyal animal. You can't talk to it per se but it always acts as you wish it to. Name your animal companion and choose a species:
*Wolf, cougar, bear, eagle, dog, hawk, cat, owl, pigeon, rat, mule*
Choose a base:
• Ferocity +2, Cunning +1, 1 Armor, Instinct +1
• Ferocity +2, Cunning +2, 0 Armor, Instinct +1
• Ferocity +1, Cunning +2, 1 Armor, Instinct +1
• Ferocity +3, Cunning +1, 1 Armor, Instinct +2
Choose as many strengths as its ferocity:
*Fast, burly, huge, calm, adaptable, quick reflexes, tireless, camouflage, ferocious, intimidating, keen senses, stealthy*
Your animal companion is trained to fight humanoids. Choose as many additional trainings as its cunning:
*Hunt, search, scout, guard, fight monsters, perform, labor, travel*
Choose as many weaknesses as its instinct:
*Flighty, savage, slow, broken, frightening, forgetful, stubborn, lame*
142.name: Animal Companion

desc: When you work with your animal companion on something it's trained in ...
•  ...and you attack the same target, add its ferocity to your damage
•  ...and you track, add its cunning to your roll
•  ...and you take damage, add its armor to your armor
•  ...and you discern realities, add its cunning to your roll
•  ...and you parley, add its cunning to your roll
•  ...and someone interferes with you, add its instinct to their roll
143.name: Command

desc: *You may only take this if it is your first advancement.*
Somewhere in your lineage lies mixed blood and it begins to show its presence. You gain the elf starting move if you took the human one at character creation or vice versa.
144.name: Half-Elven

desc: You can speak with and understand animals.
145.name: Wild Empathy

desc: When you spout lore about a monster you use WIS instead of INT.
146.name: Familiar Prey

desc: When you strike an enemy with two weapons at once, add an extra 1d4 damage for your off-hand strike.
147.name: Viper's Strike

desc: When you keep still in natural surroundings, enemies never spot you until you make a movement.
148.name: Camouflage

desc: When you allow your animal companion to take a blow that was meant for you, the damage is negated and your animal companion's ferocity becomes 0. If its ferocity is already 0 you can't use this ability. When you have a few hours of rest with your animal companion its ferocity returns to normal.
149.name: Man's Best Friend

desc: When you volley you may spend extra ammo before rolling. For each point of ammo spent you may choose an extra target. Roll once and apply damage to all targets.
150.name: Blot Out the Sun

desc: Choose another training for your animal companion.
151.name: Well-Trained

desc: Dedicate yourself to a deity (name a new one or choose one that's already been established). You gain the commune and cast a spell cleric moves. When you select this move, treat yourself as a cleric of level 1 for using spells. Every time you gain a level thereafter, increase your effective cleric level by 1.
152.name: God Amidst the Wastes

desc: When you undertake a perilous journey you can take two roles. You make a separate roll for each.
153.name: Follow Me

desc: When you set the watch for the night, everyone takes +1 to take watch.
154.name: A Safe Place

desc: *Replaces: Wild Empathy*
You can speak with and understand any non-magical, non-planar creature.
155.name: Wild Speech

desc: *Replaces: Familiar Prey*
When you spout lore about a monster you use WIS instead of INT. On a 12+, in addition to the normal effects, you get to ask the GM any one question about the subject.
156.name: Hunter's Prey

desc: *Replaces: Viper's Strike*
When you strike an enemy with two weapons at once, add an extra 1d8 damage for your off-hand strike.
157.name: Viper's Fangs

desc: When you know your target's weakest point your arrows have 2 piercing.
158.name: Smaug's Belly

desc: *Replaces: Follow Me*
When you undertake a perilous journey you can take two roles. Roll twice and use the better result for both roles.
159.name: Strider

desc: *Replaces: A Safe Place*
When you set the watch for the night everyone takes +1 to take watch. After a night in camp when you set the watch everyone takes +1 forward.
160.name: A Safer Place

desc: When you hunt and track, on a hit you may also ask one question about the creature you are tracking from the discern realities list for free.
161.name: Observant

desc: Choose a move from another class. So long as you are working with your animal companion you have access to that move.
162.name: Special Trick

desc: Your animal companion is a monster, not an animal. Describe it. Give it +2 ferocity and +1 instinct, plus a new training.
163.name: Unnatural Ally

desc: When you spend a moment to survey a dangerous area, roll+DEX.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, hold 3.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, hold 1. Spend your hold as you walk through the area to ask these questions:
• Is there a trap here and if so, what activates it?
• What does the trap do when activated?
• What else is hidden here?
164.name: Trap Expert

desc: When you pick locks or pockets or disable traps, roll+DEX.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, you do it, no problem.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, you still do it, but the GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost.
165.name: Tricks of the Trade

desc: When you attack a surprised or defenseless enemy with a melee weapon, you can choose to deal your damage or roll+DEX.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ choose two.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 choose one.
• You don't get into melee with them
• You deal your damage+1d6
• You create an advantage, +1 forward to you or an ally acting on it
• Reduce their armor by 1 until they repair it
166.name: Backstab

desc: When someone tries to detect your alignment you can tell them any alignment you like.
167.name: Flexible Morals

desc: You've mastered the care and use of a poison. Choose a poison from the list below; that poison is no longer dangerous for you to use. You also start with three uses of the poison you choose. Whenever you have time to gather materials and a safe place to brew you can make three uses of the poison you choose for free. Note that some poisons are applied, meaning you have to carefully apply it to the target or something they eat or drink. Touch poisons just need to touch the target, they can even be used on the blade of a weapon.
• Oil of Tagit (applied): The target falls into a light sleep
• Bloodweed (touch): The target deals -1d4 damage ongoing until cured
• Goldenroot (applied): The target treats the next creature they see as a trusted ally, until proved otherwise
• Serpent's Tears (touch): Anyone dealing damage to the target rolls twice and takes the better result.
168.name: Poisoner

desc: When using a precise or hand weapon, your backstab deals an extra +1d6 damage.
169.name: Cheap Shot

desc: When you use trap expert you always get +1 hold, even on a 6-.
170.name: Cautious

desc: When you make a show of flashing around your most valuable possession, choose someone present. They will do anything they can to obtain your item or one like it.
171.name: Wealth and Taste

desc: You're never caught by surprise. When an enemy would get the drop on you, you get to act first instead.
172.name: Shoot First

desc: After you've used a poison once it's no longer dangerous for you to use.
173.name: Poison Master

desc: You can apply even complex poisons with a pinprick. When you apply a poison that's not dangerous for you to use to your weapon it's touch instead of applied.
174.name: Envenom

desc: When you have time to gather materials and a safe place to brew you can create three doses of any one poison you've used before.
175.name: Brewer

desc: When you're outnumbered, you have +1 armor.
176.name: Underdog

desc: When you put out word to the criminal underbelly about something you want or need, roll+CHA.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, someone has it, just for you.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, you'll have to settle for something close or it comes with strings attached, your call.
177.name: Connections

desc: *Replaces: Cheap Shot*
When using a precise or hand weapon, your backstab deals an extra +1d8 damage and all other attacks deal +1d4 damage.
178.name: Dirty Fighter

desc: *Replaces: Cautious*

When you use trap expert you always get +1 hold, even on a 6-. On a 12+ you get 3 hold and the next time you come near a trap the GM will immediately tell you what it does, what triggers it, who set it, and how you can use it to your advantage.
179.name: Extremely Cautious

desc: *Replaces: Brewer*

When you have you have time to gather materials and a safe place to brew you can create three doses of any poison you've used before. Alternately you can describe the effects of a poison you'd like to create. The GM will tell you that you can create it, but with one or more caveats:
• It will only work under specific circumstances
• The best you can manage is a weaker version
• It'll take a while to take effect
• It'll have obvious side effects
180.name: Alchemist

desc: *Replaces: Underdog*
You have +1 armor. When you're outnumbered, you have +2 armor instead.
181.name: Serious Underdog

desc: When you defy danger on a 12+, you transcend the danger. You not only do what you set out to, but the GM will offer you a better outcome, true beauty, or a moment of grace.
182.name: Evasion

desc: You can throw any melee weapon, using it to volley. A thrown melee weapon is gone; you can never choose to reduce ammo on a 7-9.
183.name: Strong Arm, True Aim

desc: When you're in too deep and need a way out, name your escape route and roll+DEX.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ you're gone.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 you can stay or go, but if you go it costs you: leave something behind or take something with you, the GM will tell you what.
184.name: Escape Route

desc: When you have time and materials you can create a disguise that will fool anyone into thinking you're another creature of about the same size and shape. Your actions can give you away but your appearance won't.
185.name: Disguise

desc: When you take time to make a plan to steal something, name the thing you want to steal and ask the GM these questions. When acting on the answers you and your allies take +1 forward.
• Who will notice it's missing?
• What's its most powerful defense?
• Who will come after it?
• Who else wants it?
186.name: Heist

desc: You have mastered several spells and inscribed them in your spellbook. You start out with three first level spells in your spellbook as well as the cantrips. Whenever you gain a level, you add a new spell of your level or lower to your spellbook. You spellbook is 1 weight.
187.name: Spellbook

desc: When you spend uninterrupted time (an hour or so) in quiet contemplation of your spellbook, you:
• Lose any spells you already have prepared
• Prepare new spells of your choice from your spellbook whose total levels don't exceed your own level+1.
• Prepare your cantrips which never count against your limit.
188.name: Prepare Spells

desc: When you release a spell you've prepared, roll+Int.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, the spell is successfully cast and you do not forget the spell - you may cast it again later.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, the spell is cast, but choose one:
• You draw unwelcome attention or put yourself in a spot. The GM will tell you how.
• The spell disturbs the fabric of reality as it is cast - take -1 ongoing to cast a spell until the next time you Prepare Spells.
• After it is cast, the spell is forgotten. You cannot cast the spell again until you prepare spells.
Note that maintaining spells with ongoing effects will sometimes cause a penalty to your roll to cast a spell.
189.name: Cast a Spell

desc: You may end any ongoing spell immediately and use the energy of its dissipation to deflect an oncoming attack. The spell ends and you subtract its level from the damage done to you.
190.name: Spell Defense

desc: When you draw on a place of power to create a magical effect, tell the GM what you're trying to achieve. Ritual effects are always possible, but the GM will give you one to four of the following conditions:
• It's going to take days/weeks/months
• First you must ____
• You'll need help from ____
• It will require a lot of money
• The best you can do is a lesser version, unreliable and limited
• You and your allies will risk danger from ____
• You'll have to disenchant ____ to do it
191.name: Ritual

desc: Choose a spell. You prepare that spell as if it were one level lower.
192.name: Prodigy

desc: When you cast a spell, on a 10+ you have the option of choosing from the 7-9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these as well:
• The spell's effects are maximized
• The spell's targets are doubled
193.name: Empowered Magic

desc: When you spout lore about something no one else has any clue about, take +1.
194.name: Fount of Knowledge

desc: When another player's character comes to you for advice and you tell them what you think is best, they get +1 forward when following your advice and you mark experience if they do.
195.name: Know-It-All

desc: Add a new spell from the spell list of any class to your spellbook.
196.name: Expanded Spellbook

desc: When you have time and safety with a magic item you may ask the GM what it does, the GM will answer you truthfully.
197.name: Enchanter

desc: When you use strict deduction to analyze your surroundings, you can discern realities with INT instead of WIS.
198.name: Logical

desc: As long as you have at least one prepared spell of first level or higher, you have +2 armor.
199.name: Arcane Ward

desc: When you attempt to counter an arcane spell that will otherwise affect you, stake one of your prepared spells on the defense and roll+Int. :small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, the spell is countered and has no effect on you. :small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, the spell is countered and you forget the spell you staked. Your counterspell protects only you; if the countered spell has other targets they get its effects.
200.name: Counterspell

desc: When you see the effects of an arcane spell, ask the GM the name of the spell and its effects. You take +1 when acting on the answers.
201.name: Quick Study

desc: *Requires: Prodigy*
Choose one spell in addition to the one you picked for prodigy. You prepare that spell as if it were one level lower.
202.name: Master

desc: *Replaces: Empowered Magic*
When you cast a spell, on a 10-11 you have the option of choosing from the 7-9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well. On a 12+ you get to choose one of these effects for free:
• The spell's effects are doubled
• The spell's targets are doubled
203.name: Greater Empowered Magic

desc: *Requires: Enchanter*
When you have time and safety with a magic item in a place of power you can empower that item so that the next time you use it its effects are amplified, the GM will tell you exactly how.
204.name: Enchanter's Soul

desc: *Replaces: Logical*
When you use strict deduction to analyze your surroundings, you can discern realities with Int instead of Wis. On a 12+ you get to ask the GM any three questions, not limited by the list.
205.name: Highly Logical

desc: *Replaces: Arcane Ward*
As long as you have at least one prepared spell of first level or higher, you have +4 armor.
206.name: Arcane Armor

desc: *Requires: Counterspell*
When an ally within sight of you is affected by an arcane spell, you can counter it as if it affected you. If the spell affects multiple allies you must counter for each ally separately.
207.name: Protective Counter

desc: When you have time with a willing or helpless subject you can craft an ethereal tether with them. You perceive what they perceive and can discern realities about someone tethered to you or their surroundings no matter the distance. Someone willingly tethered to you can communicate with you over the tether as if you were in the room with them.
208.name: Ethereal Tether

desc: When you use magic to control a person's actions they have no memory of what you had them do and bear you no ill will.
209.name: Mystical Puppet Strings

desc: When you deal damage to a creature you can shunt a spell's energy into them - end one of your ongoing spells and add the spell's level to the damage dealt.
210.name: Spell Augmentation

desc: When you have time, arcane materials, and a safe space, you can create your own place of power. Describe to the GM what kind of power it is and how you're binding it to this place, the GM will tell you one kind of creature that will have an interest in your workings.
211.name: Self-Powered

desc: Others may content themselves with just a taste of wine, or dominion over a servant or two, but you want more. Choose two appetites. While pursuing one of your appetites if you would roll for a move, instead of rolling 2d6 you roll 1d6+1d8. If the d6 is the higher die of the pair, the GM will also introduce a complication or danger that comes about due to your heedless pursuits.
• Pure destruction
• Power over others
• Mortal pleasures
• Conquest
• Riches and property
• Fame and glory
212.name: Herculean Appetites

desc: You take +1 ongoing to last breath rolls. When you take your last breath, on a 7-9 you make an offer to Death in return for your life. If Death accepts he will return you to life. If not, you die.
213.name: The Upper Hand

desc: While you wield a weapon it gains the forceful and messy tags.
214.name: Musclebound

desc: When you cry out a challenge to your enemies, roll+Con.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ they treat you as the most obvious threat to be dealt with and ignore your companions, take +2 damage ongoing against them.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 only a few (the weakest or most foolhardy among them) fall prey to your taunting.
215.name: What Are You Waiting For?

desc: You ignore the clumsy tag on armor you wear.
216.name: Full Plate and Packing Steel

desc: So long as you are below your Load and neither wear armor nor carry a shield, take +1 armor.
217.name: Unencumbered, Unharmed

desc: Choose an additional appetite.
218.name: Still Hungry

desc: Take a move from the fighter, bard or thief class list. You may not take multiclass moves from those classes.
219.name: Appetite for Destruction

desc: When you perform a feat of strength, name someone present whom you have impressed and take +1 forward to parley with them.
220.name: My Love For You Is Like a Truck

desc: At the end of a session, if during this session you have crushed your enemies, seen them driven before you, or have heard the lamentations of their kinfolk mark XP.
221.name: What Is Best In Life

desc: You've traveled the wide world over. When you arrive someplace ask the GM about any important traditions, rituals, and so on, they'll tell you what you need to know.
222.name: Wide Wanderer

desc: When you prove yourself superior to a person in power, take +1 forward with their followers, underlings, and hangers on.
223.name: Usurper

desc: Your hirelings always accept the gratuitous fulfillment of one of your appetites as payment.
224.name: Khan of Khans

desc: You may take a debility to immediately break free of any physical or mental restraint.
225.name: Samson

desc: When you hack and slash, on a 12+ deal your damage and choose something physical your target has (a weapon, their position, a limb): they lose it.
226.name: Smash!

desc: When you take damage you can choose to take 1 ongoing until you sate one of your appetites instead of taking the damage. If you already have this penalty you cannot choose this option.
227.name: Indestructible Hunger

desc: When you discern realities add "What here is weak or vulnerable?" to the list of questions you can ask.
228.name: Eye for Weakness

desc: When you defy a danger caused by movement (maybe falling off a narrow bridge or rushing past an armed guard) take +1.
229.name: On the Move

desc: As long as you have less than your Con in current HP (or 1, whichever is higher) take +1 ongoing.
230.name: A Good Day to Die

desc: *Requires: Appetite for Destruction*
Take another move from the fighter, bard or thief class list. You may not take multiclass moves from those classes.
231.name: Kill 'em All

desc: When you enter battle with a show of force (a shout, a rallying cry, a battle dance) roll+Cha.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ both,
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 one or the other.
• Your allies are rallied and take +1 forward
• Your enemies feel fear and act accordingly (avoiding you, hiding, attacking with fear driven abandon)
232.name: War Cry

desc: When you take this move and spend some uninterrupted time reflecting on your past glories you may mark yourself with a symbol of your power (a long braid tied with bells, ritual scars or tattoos, etc.) Any intelligent mortal creature who sees this symbol knows instinctively that you are a force to be reckoned with and treats you appropriately.
233.name: Mark of Might

desc: When you satisfy an appetite to the extreme (destroying something unique and significant, gaining enormous fame, riches, power, etc.) you may choose to resolve it. Cross it off the list and mark XP. While you may pursue that appetite again, you no longer feel the burning desire you once did. In its place, choose a new appetite from the list or write your own.
234.name: More! Always More!

desc: When you defy danger, on a 12+ you turn the danger back on itself, the GM will describe how.
235.name: The One Who Knocks

desc: Whenever the unclean magic wielded by mortal men causes you to defy danger, treat any result of 6 as a 7-9.
236.name: Healthy Distrust

desc: You are initiated in the old ways, the ways of sacrifice. Choose something your gods (or the ancestor spirits, or your totem, etc) value - gold, blood, bones or the like. When you sacrifice those things as per your rites and rituals, roll+Wis.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ the GM will grant you insight into your current trouble or a boon to help you.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 the sacrifice is not enough and your gods take of your flesh as well, but still grant you some insight or boon.
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, you earn the ire of the fickle spirits.
237.name: For the Blood God

desc: When you conjure a weapon of pure flame, roll+CON.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ choose two of the following tags,
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 choose one.

:small_orange_diamond:You may treat your INT as your STR or DEX in regards to making attacks with this weapon. The weapon always begins with the fiery, touch, dangerous, and 3 uses tags. Each attack with the weapon consumes one use.
• *hand*
• *thrown, near*
• *+1 damage*
• remove the *dangerous* tag
238.name: Burning Brand

desc: When you take damage, and that damage is odd (after armor) the flames within you come to your aid. Roll 1d4 and either add that many uses to your burning brand (if active), take that result forward to summon your burning brand, or reduce the damage by that amount, your choice.
239.name: Fighting Fire With Fire

desc: When you bend a flame to your will, roll+WIS.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ it does as you command, taking the shape and movement you desire for as long as it has fuel on which to burn.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 the effect is short-lived, lasting only a moment.
240.name: Zuko Style

desc: When you gaze intensely into someone eyes, you may ask their player "what fuels the flames of your desire?" they'll answer with the truth, even if the character does not know or would otherwise keep this hidden.
241.name: Give Me Fuel, Give me Fire

desc: You may use your hands in place of tools and fire to craft metal objects. Mundane weapons, armor and metal jewelry can all be formed from their raw components. You may unmake these things, as well, but to do so without time and safety might require that you Defy Danger first.
242.name: Hand Crafted

desc: When you stare into a source of fire, looking for answers, roll+WIS On a hit, the GM will tell you something new and interesting about the current situation.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+, the GM will give you good detail.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, the GM will give you an impression. If you already know all there is to know, the GM will tell you that.
243.name: Lore of Flame

desc: When you channel the flames of fate, you may treat a missed roll as a 7-9 or a 7-9 result as a 10+. This may be a roll you or another character has made. Tell the GM something you've lost; an emotion, a memory or some innate piece of your being. You may not use this move again until you've used Burns Half As Long.
244.name: Burns Twice as Bright

desc: You gain this move when you gain Burns Twice as Bright.
When you sacrifice a victory to the flames of fate, treat any roll of 10+ as a miss.
245.name: Burns Half as Long

desc: Add the following tags to your options for Burning Brand: *messy, forceful, reach, near, far*
246.name: This Killing Fire

desc: When you introduce a new idea to an NPC, roll+CHA.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ They believe the idea to be their own and take to it with fervor
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, Their passion fades after a day or two. On a miss, they respond negatively, speaking out against the idea.
247.name: Firebrand

desc: Gain the Wizard move Ritual. The GM will always tell you what you have to sacrifice to gain the effect you desire.
248.name: Ogdru Jahad

desc: When you tempt a weak mind with your inner fire, roll+WIS.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ their will is suppressed, they'll follow you and do as you desire, so long as nothing startles or surprises them.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, the effect is only strong enough to distract or confuse them. On a miss, they become agitated and upset, your fire having sparked their hidden desires.
249.name: Moth to the Flame

desc: When you would take your last breath, don't. Instead, you may erase one of your Bonds. This is permanent and lowers your total available Bonds forever. You are alive and have 1d6 hp. If you have no more Bonds, take your last breath as normal.
250.name: Burning Bridges

desc: When you bolster the courage of others roll+CHA.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ they shake off all fear and doubt, becoming brave in an instant.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, this effect is fleeting, they realize its superficiality and resort to cowardice after a moment or two.
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, they're cowed or terrified by your presence.
251.name: The Enkindler

desc: When you insult an NPC, roll + CHA.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ you leave them no room to react, they bear your insult and the scorn of all who hear it.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 you cross a line, they will have their revenge, someday. On a miss you've gone too far, they blow up here and now.
252.name: Sick Burn

desc: Whenever you summon fire with any of your moves, you can replace it with the black fires of hell itself. This fire does not burn with heat and ignores armor, scorching the soul itself. Those creatures without souls cannot be harmed by this type of flame.
253.name: From Hell's Heart

desc: When you fuse a willing person's soul to yours, roll+CHA.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ you are bound together, able to sense each other at any distance, as well as sharing your emotional state.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9, the connection is unstable and dangerous, when you take a debility, so do they (and vice versa).
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, the branding is rejected and you both erase any Bonds you have to each other. You may write new Bonds with them at the End of Session as usual.
This fusion, once performed, cannot be undone by mortal means.
254.name: Burning Ring of Fire

desc: *Requires: Firebrand*
You may apply the effects of your Firebrand move to a group of people - a dozen or so - all at once.
255.name: Fanning the Flames

desc: When you open a channel to the burning planes and call a firestorm, tell the GM what you're sacrificing and roll+WIS. The sky opens up and fire pours like rain from it within an area about equal to a small village. Everyone and everything in the area takes damage as appropriate.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 10+ you can extinguish the storm with a little effort.
:small_orange_diamond:On a 7-9 the fires rage out of your control, spreading and gusting where they are carried by wind and weather.
:small_orange_diamond:On a miss, something cruel, intelligent and hungry comes with the storm.
256.name: Watch the World Burn
